repo.description: Vim-fork focused on extensibility and usability
repo.name: neovim

body:
Problem:
previously, adjust_start_col returned nil when completion items had different start position from lsp textEdit range
This caused the completion to fall back to `\k*$` which ignores the non-keyword characters

Solution:
- adjust_start_col: now returns the minimun start postion among all items instead of nil
- _lsp_to_complete_items: added logic to add the prefix to the items which start later than minimum, aliging all items

fixes: https://github.com/neovim/neovim/issues/37441

comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -457,6 +457,31 @@ function M._convert_results(
   end
   local prefix = line:sub((server_start_boundary or client_start_boundary) + 1, cursor_col)
   local matches = M._lsp_to_complete_items(result, prefix, client_id)
+
+  if server_start_boundary then
+    for _, match in ipairs(matches) do
+      --- @type lsp.CompletionItem
+      local item = match.user_data.nvim.lsp.completion_item
+      if item.textEdit then
+        --- @type integer?
+        local item_start_char
+        if item.textEdit.range and item.textEdit.range.start.line == lnum then
+          item_start_char = item.textEdit.range.start.character
+        elseif item.textEdit.insert and item.textEdit.insert.start.line == lnum then
+          item_start_char = item.textEdit.insert.start.character
+        end
+
+        if item_start_char then
+          local item_start_byte = vim.str_byteindex(line, encoding, item_start_char, false)
+          if item_start_byte > server_start_boundary then
+            local missing_prefix = line:sub(server_start_boundary + 1, item_start_byte)
+            --- @type string
+            match.word = missing_prefix .. match.word

comment_data.body:
Thanks for the feedback! I took a look at #32142 and it's a larger refactor that's been put into milestone 12.0 and open for a year. My pr implements what @mfussenegger suggested, normalizing items relative to min start position.
> But one issue the current implementation does have is if a server were to provide several textEdits each with a different starting word boundary. `vim.fn.complete` needs the same starting point for all items. We could address that by normalizing (trimming or extending) the completion items relative to the left (or right?)-most starting point.
- https://github.com/neovim/neovim/pull/32142#issuecomment-3607107758
And yes, my implementation requires 2 iterations, but as @mfussenegger said, this is necessary to handle mixed start positions.
> But note that to fix that, we'd have to keep iterating twice, because you need to figure out the left/right most position to be able to normalize the other entries. That requires 2 iterations.
- https://github.com/neovim/neovim/pull/32142#issuecomment-3607107758
Happy to close this one if #32142 addresses this, or this could serve as a simpler stopgap fix for #37441

comment_data.body:
My inference is that `adjust_startcol` doesn't need to be run every time. If `textEdit` is provided, the client doesn't need to infer word boundaries. 

Adjusting the word's prefix can also be done within `to_complete_items` instead of a separate for loop?  I remember I tried that in that PR before.   The number of matches is usually large. The extra for loop increases the time complexity. However, this is usually not a significant concern unless the number is exceptionally large.ðŸ˜®â€ðŸ’¨ ..I'm still confused about some of the implementations of current completions (I'm a little foolishï¼‰. but let's hear his thoughts cc @mfussenegger

+            --- @type string
+            match.word = missing_prefix .. match.word

comment_data.body:
> And yes, my implementation requires 2 iterations, but as @mfussenegger said, this is necessary to handle mixed start positions.

Given the current `vim.fn.complete(start_col)` mechanism 2 iterations are the minimum we need: 1 full iteration to determine the min/max boundaries, a second iteration to do the conversion to matches.

But the implementation here currently has one extra iteration - it modifies `match.word` in a separate third iteration. @glepnir is right that adding the `missing_prefix` could be integrated into `to_complete_items` 

Otherwise the change here looks good to me - I like that the scope is narrower and limited to fixing the mixed textEdit start location issue.

comment_data.body: It would be best to include the expanded test results and cursor position (sould be in there right ? `...>|<..` ðŸ¤”) , as I provided above.

comment_data.body:
In the `_convert_results` signature these aren't nullable and always provided. Can they be changed here?


```suggestion
--- @param line string current line content
--- @param lnum integer 0-indexed line number
--- @param encoding string encoding
```
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -282,9 +282,21 @@ end
 --- @param result vim.lsp.CompletionResult Result of `textDocument/completion`
 --- @param prefix string prefix to filter the completion items
 --- @param client_id integer? Client ID
+--- @param server_start_boundary integer? server start boundary
+--- @param line string? current line content
+--- @param lnum integer? 0-indexed line number
+--- @param encoding string? encoding

comment_data.body:
@mfussenegger the lint test for luals failed for `runtime/lua/vim/lsp/handlers.lua`, but this gonna get **deprecated** anyway
```lua
--- @deprecated remove in 0.13
--- @see # https://microsoft.github.io/language-server-protocol/specifications/specification-current/#textDocument_completion
RCS['textDocument/completion'] = function(_, result, _)
  if vim.tbl_isempty(result or {}) then
    return
  end
  local cursor = api.nvim_win_get_cursor(0)
  local row, col = cursor[1], cursor[2]
  local line = assert(api.nvim_buf_get_lines(0, row - 1, row, false)[1])
  local line_to_cursor = line:sub(col + 1)
  local textMatch = vim.fn.match(line_to_cursor, '\\k*$')
  local prefix = line_to_cursor:sub(textMatch + 1)

  local matches = completion._lsp_to_complete_items(result, prefix)
  vim.fn.complete(textMatch + 1, matches)
end
```

So I think we can ignore this, or I can make the params nullable, till then?
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -282,9 +282,21 @@ end
 --- @param result vim.lsp.CompletionResult Result of `textDocument/completion`
 --- @param prefix string prefix to filter the completion items
 --- @param client_id integer? Client ID
+--- @param server_start_boundary integer? server start boundary
+--- @param line string? current line content
+--- @param lnum integer? 0-indexed line number
+--- @param encoding string? encoding

comment_data.body: Oh, I wasn't aware of that. In that case I'd make the params nullable until that handler is removed.

comment_regular_data.body: Restarted CI. This looks like a good starting point that we can iterate on. Any other blockers?

title: fix(lsp): use LSP textEdit range for completion start boundary
